docTitle.titlePart:
The promotive effect of applying mixtures of (S)-(+)-abscisic acid and
gibberellic acid on flowering in long-day plants

byline.docAuthor:

1, * , S. Onwona-Agyeman
2 and S. Matsui

front.note: Received 27 June 2000; accepted in revised form 19 July 2000
front.keyword: Key words: (S)-(+)-Abscisic acid [SABA], Flowering, Gibberellic acid [GA 3 ], Long-day plants, Mixtures
front.div:
Abstract
Application of mixtures of natural type abscisic acid, (S)-(+)-abscisic acid (SABA), and gibberellic acid (GA 3 )
promoted floral-bud initiation and flowering in the long-day plants, spinach, pansy, primrose and petunia, even
under short-day conditions. The effective concentrations for spray application of SABA/GA 3 were restricted
within the limits of 10âˆ’1 ppm respectively. Applications of SABA and/or GA 3 as high as 50 ppm induced no
flowering. Flowering in short-day plants, dahlia, morning-glory and Christmas-cactus was not promoted by the
mixtures.
